# The Unseen Warrior
## Scripture
"He will not cry out or raise his voice, or make his voice heard in the street." â€“ Psalm 38:14
## Reflection
As men, we often feel the pressure to present a strong exterior to the world. We may struggle to balance our desire to be seen as strong and capable leaders with the need to maintain humility and dependence on God. However, the Bible reminds us that true strength lies not in our outward appearance, but in our inner character and faith.

The psalmist David, a man known for his courage and strength, writes about his own struggles with pride and self-reliance. He acknowledges that in times of weakness, he is tempted to cry out and make his voice heard, but instead, he chooses to remain silent and trust in God. This is a powerful reminder for us as men to recognize that our true strength comes from God, and that we must learn to rely on Him in all circumstances.

## Daily Challenge
"Take 10 minutes in silence to pray and ask God to reveal areas in your life where you may be relying on your own strength rather than His."
